variants.Description in input context: The G2019S mutation in LRRK2 promotes increased phosphorylation.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were transfected with constructs encoding wild-type LRRK2 or LRRK2(G2019S).

Readout description.Result Description: Phosphorylation of downstream targets (e.g., p-Serine935) was significantly increased in cells expressing LRRK2(G2019S) compared to wild-type LRRK2. Quantitation showed a 1.8-fold increase (p < 0.01).

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent transfections were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each blot included two technical replicates per sample.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test (p < 0.05)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels greater than 50% of baseline
